results.description: Use forward_price_360 minus forward_price_30 to capture long-term vs short-term forward mispricings. SUGGESTION1 applied (2 datafields: forward_price_360, forward_price_30). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage ~0.7037). SUGGESTION4: chose forward series with moderate userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation uses 1 operator and 2 datafields, under limits. Confidence set to 0.70 because term-structure often carries signal but can be macro-driven.

Z-score of forward_price_10 to detect short-term extremes. SUGGESTION1: single strong datafield forward_price_10 chosen for coverage/userCount. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not required. KEEP_IN_MIND: single datafield and 1 operator. Confidence 0.65: short-term noise but actionable.

call_breakeven_30 minus put_breakeven_30 as implied direction/skew. SUGGESTION1 used two breakeven fields. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: chose maturities with reasonable userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator, 2 datafields. Confidence 0.72: skew often predicts short-term directional flow.

ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 60) to find sustained put-call open interest imbalance. SUGGESTION1 used pcr_oi_270 with very high userCount/alphaCount. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator, 1 datafield. Confidence 0.78 because high historical use indicates robustness.

ts_delta(pcr_vol_30, 1) to capture one-day surge in put/call volume ratio. SUGGESTION1 applied with pcr_vol_30. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: single operator and field. Confidence 0.62: volume spikes can precede moves but noisy.

subtract(forward_price_90, forward_price_10) to measure medium-term forward premium vs short-term. SUGGESTION1 used multiple forwards. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not required. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator, 2 fields. Confidence 0.68: useful when option-implied funding differs across tenors.

ts_delta(pcr_oi_20, 3) detects building put demand over 3 days. SUGGESTION1 used pcr_oi_20. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 coverage ok. SUGGESTION4: moderate userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: simple. Confidence 0.6: short window noisy.

ts_delta(ts_delta(forward_price_60, 3), 1) -> implemented as ts_delta(forward_price_60, 4) approximates acceleration. SUGGESTION1 used forward_price_60. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: single operator allowed (ts_delta). Confidence 0.66 for momentum in implied forwards.

subtract(option_breakeven_720, option_breakeven_30) to detect long-short breakeven spread. SUGGESTION1 uses two maturities. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 coverage ok. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator 2 fields. Confidence 0.64: term structure signals less liquid but informative.

ts_delta(pcr_oi_30, 5) (positive means rising put/call OI). SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION4: pcr_oi_30 has moderate counts. SUGGESTION3 not required. KEEP_IN_MIND: simple. Confidence 0.63: useful as orderflow proxy.

ts_zscore(call_breakeven_10, 30) low values indicate expensive short dated downside; using call_breakeven short-dated as proxy. SUGGESTION1 used call_breakeven_10. SUGGESTION4: high userCount. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence 0.7: short-dated breakevens often spike before moves.
ts_zscore(put_breakeven_90, 40) to catch reversion in implied downside. SUGGESTION1: single field; SUGGESTION4 moderate userCount. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: one operator. Confidence 0.66.

subtract(pcr_vol_90, pcr_vol_20) measures longer horizon put volume dominance vs short. SUGGESTION1 used two pcr_vol fields. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 op, 2 fields. Confidence 0.61: volume-based signals weaker.

zscore of ts_av_diff(forward_price_120,20) implemented as ts_zscore(forward_price_120,20). SUGGESTION1 used forward_price_120. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence 0.67: medium-term forward extremes revert often.

subtract(pcr_oi_60, pcr_vol_60) to find where open interest shows put dominance but volumes do not. SUGGESTION1 used two related fields to find persistent vs transient flows. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator, 2 fields. Confidence 0.6: mixed metrics can be noisy.
ts_delta(forward_price_20, 1) to capture one-day implied forward jumps. SUGGESTION1 used forward_price_20. SUGGESTION4 moderate userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: single operator. Confidence 0.64.
subtract(call_breakeven_90, call_breakeven_10) to measure steepness of call breakeven curve. SUGGESTION1 uses two breakeven fields. SUGGESTION3 not required. KEEP_IN_MIND: simple. Confidence 0.63.

ts_zscore(subtract(pcr_oi_270, pcr_vol_270), 30) implemented as ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270,30) minus ts_zscore(pcr_vol_270,30) but to keep operators <=7 and fields <=2 we use subtract(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270,30), ts_zscore(pcr_vol_270,30)). SUGGESTION1 applied (2 fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage high). KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.75 because pcr_oi_270 has strong counts.

ts_delta(subtract(put_breakeven_30, call_breakeven_30), 5) implemented as ts_delta(subtract(put_breakeven_30, call_breakeven_30),5). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: uses 2 operators and 2 fields. Confidence 0.68.

quantile(pcr_oi_all) to rank across instruments by total OI PCR. SUGGESTION1 uses pcr_oi_all (aggregated). SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION4 moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: one operator, one field. Confidence 0.7: cross-sectional extremes persist.

subtract(ts_delta(forward_price_10,1), ts_delta(forward_price_180,1)) implemented as subtract(ts_delta(forward_price_10,1), ts_delta(forward_price_180,1)) using 2 fields and 1 operator plus nested ts_delta twice. SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND: operators <=7, fields=2. Confidence 0.66: relative jumps informative of near-term shocks.

ts_zscore(subtract(option_breakeven_360, option_breakeven_30), 60) implemented as ts_zscore(subtract(option_breakeven_360, option_breakeven_30),60). SUGGESTION1 used two maturities. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.62: lower liquidity longer-term.

greater(pcr_oi_60, 1.2) boolean to flag heavy put OI (1.2 threshold). SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION4 moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: simple comparison. Confidence 0.59: threshold heuristic, needs calibration.
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_10, 10) high zscore indicates put volume dominance short-term (calls relatively low). SUGGESTION1 used pcr_vol_10. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: single op. Confidence 0.61.

ts_std_dev(forward_price_30, 20) measures variability in short-term implied forward. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. KEEP_IN_MIND simple. Confidence 0.63: volatility measure predictive of option premia.

subtract(ts_zscore(call_breakeven_60,30), ts_zscore(put_breakeven_60,30)) implemented as subtract(ts_zscore(call_breakeven_60,30), ts_zscore(put_breakeven_60,30)). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. KEEP_IN_MIND: two operators nested, two fields. Confidence 0.69: relative zscores helpful.

subtract(ts_delta(pcr_oi_90,7), ts_delta(pcr_oi_20,7)) to see if long-tenor buildup exceeds short. SUGGESTION1 used two pcr_oi fields. SUGGESTION4 chosen pcr_oi_90 high counts. KEEP_IN_MIND OK. Confidence 0.65.

subtract(forward_price_30, option_breakeven_30) to identify discrepancies between synthetic forward and option breakeven. SUGGESTION1 used these two related fields. SUGGESTION4 acceptable. KEEP_IN_MIND: one operator two fields. Confidence 0.71: direct arbitrage signal.
quantile(put_breakeven_10) cross-sectional to pick extreme implied downsides. SUGGESTION1 uses put_breakeven_10. SUGGESTION4 high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: single operator. Confidence 0.72.
ts_sum(pcr_vol_20, 5) capturing 5-day cumulative put volume dominance. SUGGESTION1 used pcr_vol_20. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: single operator. Confidence 0.6.
subtract(call_breakeven_60, forward_price_60) to find option-implied strike vs forward. SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.66.
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20, 15) SUGGESTION1 used pcr_oi_20; SUGGESTION4 okay. KEEP_IN_MIND: single op. Confidence 0.64.

subtract(subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_180), subtract(forward_price_90, forward_price_30)) implemented as subtract(subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_180), subtract(forward_price_90, forward_price_30)). SUGGESTION1 used multiple forwards but fields<=2? This uses 4 fields, violates KEEP_IN_MIND. To comply, use subtract(subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_90), subtract(forward_price_180, forward_price_30)) â€” still 4 fields. Adjust: use subtract(subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_90), forward_price_30) uses 3 fields and 3 operators; still >2 fields. To comply must use <=2 datafields; instead propose curvature as subtract(subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_90), 0) not meaningful. Therefore we skip complex curvature to stay within limits: implement curvature proxy as subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_90). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.63.
ts_delta(put_breakeven_20, 1) short-dated jump. SUGGESTION1 used put_breakeven_20. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: simple. Confidence 0.65.
subtract(pcr_oi_90, pcr_oi_all) to detect whether 90-day tenor unusually heavy. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. KEEP_IN_MIND OK. Confidence 0.67.

subtract(ts_zscore(option_breakeven_120,30), ts_zscore(option_breakeven_30,30)) implemented as subtract(ts_zscore(option_breakeven_120,30), ts_zscore(option_breakeven_30,30)). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. KEEP_IN_MIND OK. Confidence 0.61.
quantile(forward_price_30) to rank implied forward across universe. SUGGESTION1 uses forward_price_30 with good userCount. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied. Confidence 0.68.
subtract(pcr_vol_10, pcr_vol_30) to find short-term vs month volume mismatch. SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 op 2 fields. Confidence 0.58.
ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_270, 60) measuring variability in long-tenor PCR OI. SUGGESTION1 used pcr_oi_270 (very high userCount). KEEP_IN_MIND: simple. Confidence 0.7.
ts_rank(forward_price_60, 20) cross-time rank to capture momentum in implied forward. SUGGESTION1 used forward_price_60. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence 0.65.
zscore(put_breakeven_30) cross-sectional normalization. SUGGESTION1 used put_breakeven_30. SUGGESTION4 moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: one operator. Confidence 0.69.
subtract(pcr_oi_20, pcr_oi_720) detect if short-tenor PCR exceeds long-tenor. SUGGESTION1 two fields. KEEP_IN_MIND OK. Confidence 0.62.
ts_zscore(call_breakeven_60, 30). SUGGESTION1 uses single high-quality field. KEEP_IN_MIND OK. Confidence 0.66.
